data.title: A piece of home
data.text:
As a good ole Cajun boy I had to try this place and get a taste of home. Well this is a small little spot but the moment you walk in you feel at home. The Zydeco music is playing and you are greeted with hospitality. 

I had the "sampler" and it was quite tasty, however the Crawfish Etouffee could use seasoning. The cornbread was perfect and the Gumbo was delicious. My disappointment was the Boundin balls which were not in any shape of a ball. I feel they were rushed and came out as crunchy rice. 

If you enjoy Cajun food, give this place a try.

data.title: Great Cajun!
data.text: Beignets are the best ever at this restaurant! My family loves their food, and we get it often for takeout or eat there. The staff is friendly and helpful. I don't mind bussing my own table.

data.title: Quick and good
data.text: This place started as a food truck and makes a good place for a quick bite.I enjoy everything on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. Typically i get their Bayou Boogie or The Sampler but the Gumbo is just as good. Recently they have added two sizes (a smaller portion for $6) which has been great for my wife. They give a good portion for the price and you won't leave hungry. The staff is friendly and engaging and the place is always clean.

data.title: Cajun food in Gresham
data.text: A Cajun Life is a welcome addition to downtown Gresham; however it is a small bistro with only one employee. If you eat in, you are expected to bus your table. Most people order to-go. The crawfish étouffée was pretty good, but the gumbo was too salty and spicy for me. It also has no okra as a previous reviewer had remarked. No veggies or green side dishes were offered on the menu. The beignets were just OK. We had a Groupon and were able to save quite a bit. Not sure if I'd go back due to the limited menu options.

data.title: Beignets a must !!
data.text: My wife and I stopped in today and enjoyed the Crawfish Etouffee and Beignets Bites. Both were amazing. Lots of crawfish in the dish, very well spiced for us. We were very excited to try the Beignets. Also amazing. We found our place to revisit in Gresham!!

data.title: Spicy and good!
data.text: My wife and I ate here two days ago. Cajun fast food. They have takeout or you can eat in the restaurant on regular plates with silverware. Reasonably priced. I had the combo. The ettufle was great. The portions are medium in size. We'll go back again.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: Very good,  quick service and great authentic cajun cuisine.   Gumbo was very good,  as was the blackened chicken po boy.

data.title: Beignets here in Gresham????? Yes, please!
data.text: Gave them a try...catfish po'boy was just ok in my book.  Jambalaya smelled amazing, and plan on trying that on my next visit.  Beignets were pretty good for outside New Orleans.  I did find the prices a little high...would be inclined to stop by more often if prices were more reasonable.

data.title: Friendly service
data.text: The staff was very friendly and we were served quickly.  The food was average tasting.  Not in a hurry to go back.

data.title: Cajun food, not for foodies
data.text: Having lived in the south this place does a decent job of preparing Louisiana local fare however they are missing a few critical ingredients - namely okra.  If they can source and include okra, including a fresh fried okra side than I am all in.

data.title: My daughter suggested we eat here
data.text:
This is more of a fast food, prepared in advance type of cuisine.
It was good for some quick eats, I had the beans and rice. I would go again if it was suggested but I make a pretty wicked gumbo at home. The food was tasty.

data.title: Try this....
data.text:
LOVE the red beans and rice!  Very tasty and filling.  Sit outdoors and watch the people on a Saturday.  Very nice.
Menu is limited, but price is reasonable and food is good.

data.title: Another Taste Adventure
data.text:
A Cajun Life offers another unique option for those who like variety in food.  Nestled among several restaurant that in easy walking distance offer sandwiches, ice cream, Lebanese, American, options, A Cajun Life focuses mostly on take out but has responded to it's clients by providing indoor seating as well.  The management says that it's now fifty, fifty take out vs sit in traffic. 

Our selection, ample, at a good price point, tasty, spiced not too hot, chicken and vegetables.  The result is an invitation to try this again.

data.title: Delicious Authentic Cajun food
data.text: The Gumbo is AMAZING! Actually everything on the menu is great.  The Beignets are to die for! Every time we go the food is consistently excellent.

data.title: Great Gresham Addition
data.text: Although A Cajun Life has only been opened two weeks in Gresham, I consider it a resounding success. Having tried over half their menu items, I haven't found a single one I didn't like. If you have to choose (as everyone does), the Sampler would be a good place to start as you're introduced to two items...Bayou Boogie & Crawfish Etouffee. The staff is knowledgeable, helpful, & very friendly.  They offer fountain drinks along with some unique southern treats. Be sure you leave room for their Beignets; just make sure you don't wear something dark or you'll be exhibiting evidence of your indulgence.
